result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Todd Wills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber granted.
May serve in Green Lake County
Consecutive to: any other sentence

Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Bond to be applied to costs; balance to be returned to the party that posted it

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Todd Wills

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Benjamin Todd Wills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Benjamin Todd Wills in custody in Green Lake County Jail.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Misd. Bail Jumping 946-49(1)(a), Class A Misd.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement ot the amended Ct. 1.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 60 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
Report forthwith; defendant is to remain in custody
May serve in Green Lake County
Credit = 6 days
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt:
Bond and Paperwork from Green Lake County where bond was posted
Forwarded to Marquette County Clerk of Court for receipt
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 19, 2017 at 11:30 am.

*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*Court ordered an additional $250 cash to be posted*

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz appeared by phone means for Defendant Benjamin Todd Wills. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin Todd Wills in court.
Court questions defense as to why the defendant did not appear at the last hearing.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant was in custody in Illinois and that matter is taken care of now.  Defendant has been in custody since January 19th.

Atty Hendee states that the defendant has four open cases in Green Lake County, all in Warrant status.  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Gumz asks that the cash bail be reinstated.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders an additional $250 cash bond with conditions.
Set Plea/Sentencing

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 19, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was not in custody as of last week.  Atty Gumz states that in checking with Winnebego county, the defendant is in custody with a hearing on February 21st.  Atty Gumz asks the court to continue the matter until after February 21st.
Atty Hendee requests a warrant today.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 2, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant was taken into custody in South Beloit; requests Warrant.
Atty Gumz asks the court to not issue the warrant due to the parties knowing that he is in custody and asks for a reset.  

BY THE COURT:  Since the defendant is in custody a warrant will not be issued at this time.  Reset.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 19, 2017 at 10:45 am.

Defendant Benjamin Todd Wills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the matter is close to resolution and asks for a plea to be set.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea/sentencing
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Return date on December 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Benjamin Todd Wills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms the defendant's address.    Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court questions the defense on time limits.
Atty Gumz waives the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived.
Set for Return
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Benjamin Todd Wills
Current: PO Box 562, Ripon, WI 54971 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2016)
Prior: N2725 Welk Rd, Markesan, WI 53946
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that the defendant did contact him this afternoon.  The defendant had car issues; he would be available by telephone if needed.  Atty Gumz asks that the matter be reset to Oct. 24th.

BY THE COURT:  Reset IA.
bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Cash bond posted in GL County on 09-23-16
